item.title: Allyson add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Society often forgives the criminal; it never forgives the dreamer." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Harry S. Truman
item.description: "The only thing new in the world is the history you do not know." -- Harry S. Truman

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "If a man watches three football games in a row, he should be declared legally dead." -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Under certain circumstances, profanity provides a relief denied even to prayer."
[<i>Mark Twain, a Biography</i>]" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "If you kin see de light at daybreak, you don't keer if you die at dusk. It's so many people never seen de light at all." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "There is no single face in nature, because every eye that looks upon it, sees it from its own angle. So every man's spice-box seasons his own food." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Ronald Reagan
item.description: "I have left orders to be awakened at any time during national emergency, even if I'm in a cabinet meeting." -- Ronald Reagan

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Robert Orben
item.description: "Illegal aliens have always been a problem in the United States. Ask any Indian." -- Robert Orben

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "When you are courting a nice girl an hour seems like a second. When you sit on a red-hot cinder a second seems like an hour. That's relativity." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description:
"Alice laughed. 'There's no use trying,' she said. 'One can't believe impossible things.'
I daresay you haven't had much practice,' said the Queen. 'When I was your age, I always did it for half-an-hour a day. Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast. There goes the shawl again!" -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Allyson add a quote by The Dalai Lama
item.description: "If a problem is fixable, if a situation is such that you can do something about it, then there is no need to worry. If it's not fixable, then there is no help in worrying. There is no benefit in worrying whatsoever." -- The Dalai Lama

item.title: Allyson add a quote by Frank A. Clark
item.description: "Every adult needs a child to teach; it’s the way adults learn." -- Frank A. Clark
